Key Match Events: Ryne Nelson struck out Lindor five times before he hit a game-tying home run in the sixth inning
David Peterson pitched a seven-inning gem, retiring the heart of the Arizona lineup in the seventh inning
Jose Iglesias scored the winning run with a double to left-center in the ninth inning
Edwin Díaz secured the win with a save after addressing a mechanical flaw
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of finding a way to win despite setbacks
Díaz worked with pitching coach Jeremy Hefner to address a mechanical flaw
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the team's resilience and ability to find ways to win
Díaz stated that the team needs him to perform well in critical situations
Díaz expressed confidence in the team's current form and proximity to achieving their goals
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jeff McNeil committed an error that helped Arizona put runners on the corners with one out in the seventh inning
Edwin Díaz's fastball was clocked at 101 mph
